trans-unit.source: Defines the credential policy to be used for resource requests that are made using <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> and its derived classes.
The credential policy determines whether to send credentials when sending a <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> for a network resource, such as the content of a Web page.

If credentials are sent, servers that require client authentication can attempt to authenticate the client when the request is received instead of sending a response that indicates that the client's credentials are required.
While this saves a round trip to the server, this performance gain must be balanced against the security risk inherent in sending credentials across the network.
When the destination server does not require client authentication, it is best not to send credentials.
> [!NOTE] > ICredentialPolicy policies are invoked only if the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> or the <xref:System.Net.WebProxy> that is associated with the request has credentials that are not `null`.
Setting this policy has no effect on requests that do not specify credentials.
Use the <xref:System.Net.AuthenticationManager.CredentialPolicy%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to set an ICredentialPolicy policy.

The <xref:System.Net.IAuthenticationModule> that handles authentication for the request will invoke the <xref:System.Net.ICredentialPolicy.ShouldSendCredential%2A> method before performing the authentication.
If the method returns `false`, authentication is not performed.
An ICredentialPolicy policy affects all instances of <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> with non-null credentials in the current application domain.
The policy cannot be overridden on individual requests.
Returns a <xref:System.Boolean> that indicates whether the client's credentials are sent with a resource request made using an instance of the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> class.

After an <xref:System.Net.ICredentialPolicy> policy has been specified by setting the <xref:System.Net.AuthenticationManager.CredentialPolicy%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property, the <xref:System.Net.IAuthenticationModule> that handles authentication for a <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> invokes the ShouldSendCredential method before performing the authentication.
If this method returns `false`, authentication is not performed.

When the original request has been redirected or proxy authentication is required, the resource identified by `challengeUri` can be different from the requested resource that is specified in <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.RequestUri%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
In the case of redirection, `challengeUri` contains the actual destination <xref:System.Uri>.
If proxy authentication is required, `challengeUri` contains the address of the proxy server that requires client authentication.
The <xref:System.Uri> that will receive the request.
For more information, see the Remarks section.
The <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> that represents the resource being requested.
The <xref:System.Net.NetworkCredential> that will be sent with the request if this method returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Net.IAuthenticationModule"></xref> that will conduct the authentication, if authentication is required.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the credentials are sent with the request; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
